page.title: 03Changes in Long Sandall.
page.content:
{Long Sandall}was mentioned in the Domesday Book. It was owned by Earl Tosti. He lived in the Great Manor House of Hexthorpe. Long Sandall was later a peaceful village - a rural community. In{1851}there were one hundred and forty one people living there. There were thirty-one houses. Most of the families were large. The main jobs were canal workers, railway workers and farming.
Today, the village is dying. Many of the houses are boarded up and are going to be knocked down. Even though there are about seven houses still standing there are only two families that remain.
